content: yeah, I feel this. Although I took another path: php on the server, js on the client. I figure this is a setup that will be valid for at least another 10 years, if not longer, and so will serve me well past retirement. The node ecosystem is just too much of a moving target to build on for an old-timer like me, who have learned to eye everything new and shiny with a healthy dose of skepticism (remember left-pad? https://www.theregister.co.uk/2016/03/23/npm_left_pad_chaos/) . And no, js didn’t and won’t eat everything else. Just like nosql didn’t eat sql, and c++ still rules. Powerful indents to be sure. Eaten, no.
